alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central McDowell, northeastern Buncombe and southwestern Yancey Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Downtown Asheville, or near B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Warren Wilson College, Black Mountain, Weaverville, Swannanoa, East Asheville, Montreat and Barnardsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
